block.p: Rita Pietropinto and Thomas Robert Kitt were married last evening by Rabbi Charles Davidson at the Pierre Hotel in New York. The Rev. Charles J. O'Byrne, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.

The bride, 29, a television, film and stage actor, is the voice of Aunt Amy on ''Daria,'' an animated series on MTV. She appeared in the Roundabout Theater production of ''London Assurance,'' the British parlor comedy that was nominated for a Tony Award in 1997. She is also the chairwoman of the drama department at the Marymount School of New York. She graduated from Columbia University, from which she also received a master's degree in acting.

She is also the chairwoman of the drama department at the Marymount School of New York. She graduated from Columbia University, from which she also received a master's degree in acting.

The bride is a daughter of Joy Ann Pietropinto and Dr. Anthony Pietropinto of New York. Her father, a psychiatrist, practices in New York and is the medical director of Community Counseling and Mediation, a mental health clinic for adults and children in Brooklyn. He is also an author of ''Beyond the Male Myth.''
The bridegroom, 26, is a pianist, composer and musical director for regional theater and Off Off Broadway productions. He is also the leader of the Tom Kitt Band, a rock ensemble.

He is a son of Judith and Howard Kitt of Bedford, N.Y. His mother is a broker with Vannier/GMAC Real Estate in Armonk, N.Y. His father is an economist and a senior vice president for antitrust, health care and labor practices at National Economic Research Associates in White Plains.
